My dear Mr. Marvin:
I have your courteous letter of August
21st and appreciate the friendly spirit in which
you write.
There seems to be some confusion as to
the Mills Field situation.
My Father leased the field to the City
with the understanding
that the City could use it
more or less on an experimental basis until a perma-
nent location could be found.
